definition: to go against/to be contrary to/perverse/rebellious
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: Another is recognition of the truth of the Easterlin paradox.
sentences.chinese: 另外一项则是对伊斯特林悖论真实性的承认。

sentences.english: If ribosomes depended on proteins to function, that would have been a paradox.
sentences.chinese: 如果核糖体依靠蛋白质起作用，那会变成一个悖论。

sentences.english: Paradox holds self-negation as it's content, furthermore self-negation is its essence.
sentences.chinese: 悖论以否定自身为内容，自我否定是它的本质。

sentences.english: Self-reference of description is the necessary logical condition that forms paradoxes.
sentences.chinese: 描述自指是悖论产生的必要逻辑条件。

sentences.english: Sowe have now resolved this paradox.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们现在解决了这个悖论。

sentences.english: Could you please explaining briefly on your thinking of the conflicts between ontology and constructionism?
sentences.chinese: 您是否可以对本体论和建构论之间的悖论稍作解释？

sentences.english: Analyses on the epistemic paradoxes (paradox of knowledge or Knower paradox) are of great philosophical and logical significance.
sentences.chinese: 认知悖论的研究具有重要的哲学和逻辑意义。

sentences.english: The grue paradox is the paradoxical state in the theory of belief acceptance.
sentences.chinese: 绿蓝悖论是信念接受理论中出现的一种悖谬状态。

sentences.english: The only exception is Giffen's paradox .
sentences.chinese: 唯一的特例是吉芬悖论。

sentences.english: That's just one of the great paradoxes of our time.
sentences.chinese: 这仅仅是我们时代的一个大的悖论。

sentences.english: Only the law of causation is the key to solve the problem of logic paradox.
sentences.chinese: 只有因果律才能彻底解决逻辑悖论问题。

sentences.english: In fact, today I want to offer what I call the Five Great Paradoxes of the New Economy.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，今天我要提出我所谓的新经济五大悖论。

sentences.english: Therefore Hsia's related articles are full of paradoxes.
sentences.chinese: 对此，夏志清的相关文章也是充满悖论的。

sentences.english: Paradox is a polysemy with several layers of concepts.
sentences.chinese: “悖论”是一个多义词，表达着多个概念。

sentences.english: Nobody was going to make me into a leader, so I was snared in a paradox.
sentences.chinese: 没人能把我培养成领导，结果我自己陷入了悖论。

definition: circular argument/logical error consisting of begging the question/Latin: petitio principii
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
proposition (logic, math.)/to assign an essay topic
agnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that some questions about the universe are in principle unanswerable
pluralism, philosophical doctrine that the universe consists of different substances
either this or that/one or the other
